feed.title: Reiterating centralized coinjoin (Wasabi & Samourai) deanonymization attacks

entry.title: Reiterating centralized coinjoin (Wasabi & Samourai) deanonymization attacks
entry.summary: In the discussion, Yuval Kogman and Javier Mateos delve into a timeline related to the operations of the Kruw'd coordinator, alongside its implications for the Bitcoin development community. The conversation marks specific dates that are crucial to understanding the sequence of events: the Kruw'd coordinator commenced its operations three months prior to their exchange, a notable podcast appearance by an involved party occurred two months before, and a significant change was merged seven months earlier despite receiving negative acknowledgments (NACKs). This timeline not only sheds light on the chronological order of events but also highlights the contentious nature of the change within the community. Additionally, the inclusion of a link to the podcast provides further context for those interested in exploring the topic in depth, demonstrating the importance of multimedia resources in enriching discussions within the Bitcoin Development Mailing List group. This conversation is part of a larger thread within the Google Groups "Bitcoin Development Mailing List," indicating an ongoing dialogue among subscribers about developments that have potential impacts on Bitcoin's evolution and governance.
